page.title: 15Woodham Ferrers Transport
page.content: The main form of transport in the village is the motor car. Most families have at least one & many have 2 or more. Road tax is Â£90 pa. The average price of a gallon of petrol is Â£1.95. The building of the new town of South Woodham 2\ miles to the south of the old village an enormous increase in the volume of traffic has resulted. Many village residents have complained about the noise and hope a bypass may be built in the future. The bus service through the area is infrequent and expensive as it costs over two pounds to Chelmsford. An electricfied rail link direct to Liverpool Street is planned. Average price of a family car is Â£5000. Motorcycles are still popular with young people and training schemes operate. The bicycle is still a favourite with young children.
